Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2016
Domino Sky: 沙盒模拟家族的又一新成员
正如商店页面的介绍那样，我们可以在PC上玩多米诺骨牌了！
通过有限但充裕的domino来完成一定的收集要素以过关，短短的40关大概占用2小时的时间。新奇的场景让我们看到了domino这一古老的游戏仍能给我们带来欢乐，适合年龄6+。
作为一个沙盒模拟类的先行版本，缺点不可避免：
1) 游戏本身存在良性bug，例如重新开始的保存机制经常失效，皮肤更换经常无效，等等；
2) 关卡设计有待提高，某些关卡利用运动道具能产生额外动力，与domino的游戏本意不符(二项分布那关严重差评)；
3) 物理引擎中规中矩(可能完全交给u3d了)，完全可以提高；
4) 画面(质)上过于保守。
期待：
1) 更加丰富的挑战，全新的关卡设计，场景道具以及成就系统；
2) 开放创意工坊；
3) 排除所有可能的非引擎bug；
4) 尽量选取缓和的背景音乐，太激昂有点违和。

总结：沙盒模拟题材最重要的就是在显示器里去重现现实中的物理情景，并提供一个现实难以实现的沙盒来丰富游戏的内容。不同于某些“大跃进式”的前辈们，小团队的资源限制虽使Domino Sky体量不大，但细节专注，诚意满满。

Ps: 可能什么时候国内开发一个“弹珠模拟”，我会十分乐意一试的。


Domino Sky: a new family member of the sandbox-simulation games
As the store page shows, we can play dominoes on PC!
Using limited but plenty dominos to complete tasks with a certain collection of elements, 40 missions take U about 2 hours. Novelty scene allows U to see that the age-old domino game can still bring us joy. Recommended for ages 6+.
As an early access of a sandbox simulation always, be with inevitable shortcomings:
1) Several not-so-harm bugs, such as last dominos saving often failed when restart, skin replacement often ineffective, and so on;
2) Level design needs to be improved. Some levels utilize motion props can generate additional power which goes fully against the intention of domino game;
3) Quite simple physics engine, can be improved;
4) Too conservative with the graphic.
look forward to:
1) More challenges, the new level design, scene props and achievements;
2) Steam Workshop supported;
3) Exclude all possible non-engine bugs;
4) Peaceful BGM, not emotional.

Summary: The most important mission of Sandbox simulationin is to reproduce realistic physical situations in a display, and to provide a realistic elusive sandbox to enrich the content of the game. Unlike some of the "Great Leap Forward" predecessors, Russpuppy, this small team with limited resources makes Domino Sky a small volume, but the focused details and full of sincerity.

Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2017
Achievements: All standard and possible. They're given simply for beating levels. There's no achievements associated with the last two levels, though.

Pros/♥♥♥♥:
+ Surprisingly good controls. Mouse wheel is for rotation. WASD moves the camera. Space/shift raises and lowers. It's all very fluid.
+ Oddly satisfying gameplay. There's nothing quite like toppling over a line of dominoes without having to pick them back up.
+ Unlockable patterns for the dominoes.
+ Free play mode.
+ Fun mechanics (ramps, balls, etc.)
+ The domino limit per each level is rather lenient, allowing for a casual challenge.

- I experienced some issues with the framerate dropping every so often-- not enough to discourage me from playing, but still annoying.
- Sometimes the physics were a little janky. For example, I'd fail a level then retry(with no changes) and somehow win.
- Restarting a level after a failed attempt would sometimes leave a stray domino that I'd deleted earlier.
- Some levels seemed entirely based on luck.
- You cannot stack dominoes.

Overall:
Domino Sky was surprisingly fun. For $3.99, I got ~3 hours of gameplay out of it. It's not a bad priced given that I did not mess around too much with the free play mode. Physics puzzlers are always a blast-- especially when the levels are so satisfying to figure out and complete. Though my troubles with stutters and overall jankiness was frustrating, they didn't quite hinder my enjoyment of this game. I liked this one. I'd recommend it.

Évaluation publiée le 28 avril 2016
Gameplay
bei Domino Sky handelt es sich um ein Spiel bei dem man Dominosteine so aufbauen muss das man durch umfallen, objekte, Rutschen und viele andere Dinge eine Kettenreaktion auslöst. Das Ziel ist es verschiedene Objekte durch diese Kettenreaktion zu sammeln und am Ende einen Endpunkt zu berühren. Wie funktioniert das ganze nun? Das Spiel hat viele Level aus denen man Auswählen kann. Anfangs ist nur 1 spielbar, mit jedem geschafften wird nun ein neues Freigeschalten. Nach dem wählen des Levels gelangt man auf ein Spielfeld auf dem schon bestimmte Objekte wie Rutschen, rollende Steine, Abgründe, bewegliche Platformen und vieles mehr aufgebaut sind und man sieht mehrere kleine leuchtende Punkte und 1 großen. Die kleinen Objekte müssen gesammelt werden um das große freizuschalten und das Level zu beenden. An einem gewissen Punkte sieht man einen Anfangspunkt hinter dem sich eine Hand befindet welche den ersten Stein umschmeissen soll und somit die Kettenreaktion startet. Ziel ist es nun die Dominosteine auf desem Feld so aufzubauen das alle Objekte gesammelt werden (Hier zählt nur wenn sie von einem umfallenden Stein berührt werden) und am Ende ein Stein auf den großen aktiven Punkt fällt.

Positives
- Einfache Steuerung
- viele Levels
- Grafisch einfach gehalten wodurch man meist einen guten Überblick behält
- Steam Achievements
- Keine Abstürze
- Lief absolut Flüssig

Negatives
- Wird nach ein paar Stunden doch etwas eintönig
- Manche Level haben sehr viele Platformen und man hat doch einen etwas komplizierten ablauf wenn man dauernd rein und rauszoomen muss
- Manchmal verhält sich das Spiel bei mehreren Starts mit gleichem Aufbau unterschiedlich, so startete ich ein Level mehrfach mit einem rollenden Stein, 3 x flog der Stein vom Spielfeld oder blieb an Steinen hängen, beim 4. Versuch rollte er richtig und traf doch noch den STein wodurch das Level geschafft wurde.


Fazit
Ein kleines schönes Domino Spiel das an alte Zeiten erinnert jedoch mehr bietet als für einen als Kind möglich war durch bewegliche Objekte. Für einige Stunden bietet das Spiel durchaus Spaß und ist auch herausfordernd.

Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem Reviewprogramm
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-

Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2017
Growing up I had a couple of domino sets designed to set up and knock down. My friend and I would set them up, knock 'em down, gather all sorts of stuff to incorporate into our runs. I still have my sets and my kids enjoy playing with them, but not as much as I did.

Enter Domino Sky. A video game where you can set 'em up and knock 'em down, but without the mess. This is a puzzle game where you have a set number of dominoes you can place. You must hit each of the checkpoints in the level before a star will light up. Hit that star (after it is lit) and you advance to the next level. There is also a freeform area where you can set-up whatever you want and knock it down.

The puzzles aren't too difficult in theory. There are new things that are introduced to spice it up: rotating and moving platforms, large blue "dominoes" you have to hit hard, orange platforms you can't build on, but need to find a way around. There are even some levels in space where the dominoes don't fall and continue on without any resistance.

As I said, the puzzles aren't too difficult in theory. In reality, the physics engine for this game sucks. Set up some dominoes, knock them down 10 times and they will not fall the exact same way any of the 10 times. I think they fall differently based on the camera view but not certain. There is one puzzle with some conveyors and not only do the dominoes fall differently, I noticed they move at different speeds on the conveyor. In the several puzzles that timing and placement matters, this becomes a frustrating exercise of trial and error with a huge helping of luck. Not fun.

The other issue is you can only place dominoes on the surface. There is no stacking of dominoes on top of each other to create pyramids or other neat structures. In free form mode, all you have is a large flat area. You can't add any of the "fun" structures from the puzzles to create your own designs.

I find this game very hard to recommend.

Évaluation publiée le 15 septembre 2020
Un jeu aux mécaniques simples, consistant à réaliser des cascades de dominos pour atteindre des objectifs précis.
Simple, du moins en théorie ! En pratique, certains niveaux sont de vrais casse-têtes !
Heureusement, il est possible de recommencer chaque niveau sans perdre sa configuration de dominos, pour ainsi effectuer seulement les changements nécessaires : suppression, ajout, ou rotation de dominos.
Même si parfois les dernières modifications ne sont pas toujours prises en compte lorsque l'on recommence un niveau (le dernier domino supprimé est de retour par exemple), Domino Sky est globalement réussi et permet de passer un bon moment.
Pour les amateurs de casse-têtes et réflexion.

Évaluation publiée le 6 mai 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Domino Sky, desenvolvido pela Russpuppy, é um divertidíssimo jogo de puzzle com um conceito antigo e básico: Derrubar dominós em fileira.

Mas embora o conceito não seja nada novo, é a forma como é aplicado que o grande ponto forte de Domino Sky. Pra começar, tudo poderia ir por água abaixo se a simples física do jogo não fosse boa. O que não é o caso. A física do jogo é perfeita e a sua percepção de peso, de impulsão, funciona desde o começo. Você não vai acabar descobrindo que a física do jogo é diferente da física na vida real, tendo que se acostumar com essa nova realidade. Não, Domino Sky funciona quase praticamente igual um jogo semelhante funcionaria de verdade.

O jogo possui muitos, mas muitos levels. E os desafios aumentam. Você, para ganhar pontos e destravar os níveis seguintes, precisar ativar certos checkpoints. E conforme o jogo progride, tais checkpoints estarão nos lugares mais absurdos. O jogo usa diversas plataformas, níveis elevados, escadas, até espécies de balanças. A quantidade de mecânicas existentes é surpreendente, e o jogo nunca fica repetitivo, cada nível é um desafio diferente.

Os gráficos deixam a desejar, mas convenhamos, não é necessário nada além disso. Porém, se a direção de arte fosse um pouco mais trabalhada, talvez a experiência poderia ser levemente mais prazerosa do que já é. Já a trilha é muito boa, relaxante e condizente com o estilo do jogo.

Prós:

- Quantidade enorme de níveis
- Diversas mecânicas diferentes a cada level, sempre trazendo coisas novas e se repetindo muito pouco
- Física impecável, te fazendo entedê-la desde o começo, tamanha sua semelhança com a vida real

Contras:

- Direção de arte pouco inspirada

Nota final:

8.5/10

Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2017
Domino Sky est un jeu qui aurait pu être fun, un concept pourtant simple, je veux dire, n'importe quel moteur physique peut faire du Domino Express sans problèmes.

L'ambiance est là, les premiers puzzles sont plutôt sympa; mais malheureusement au fil du jeu, on se rends compte des bugs.
D'abord les dominos personnalisés qui sont ingérable, le jeu revient sur les dominos classique au bout du premier retry; de plus la gestion des dominos de couleurs est beaucoup trop archaïque (pas d'option pour décaler la couleur automatiquement après la pose de chaque pièce pour faire des arcs-en-ciel...).
Ensuite, à chaque retry le jeu peut annuler les dernières pièces posées comme ça, sans prévenir. Ce qui est extrêmement frustrant pour un puzzle contenant de la physique et donc beaucoup d'essais.

Et en parlant d'essais, le problème général du jeu est là. Les derniers niveaux sont entièrement basés sur la RNG et non plus sur la technique, déjà au niveau 23 le niveau est juste un gros pachinko, peu après on a littéralement un champ de mine puis des niveaux qui demandent de prévoir la chute des dominos après une explosion. Un bon puzzle ne devrait pas reposer sur l'aléatoire au risque de devenir extrêment frustrant. Par ailleurs il n'y a pas assez de niveaux en apesanteurs qui sont nettement plus intéressant que de prévoir des chutes et essayer d'empiler des pièces sur un tapis roulant.
EDIT: j'ai dorénavant fini le jeu, et je retire ce que j'ai dit sur les niveaux en apesanteurs, ou du moins, que j'y porterais un plus grand intérêt si la technique ne revenait pas systématiquement à du gros bourrinisme en plaçant toutes les pièces possible devant la main et en espérant que ça marche (et ça marche...). Vraiment dommage que le level design repose tellement sur l'aléatoire alors qu'en plus les développeurs on pu faire preuve de pouvoir faire des niveaux corrects, avec le dernier qui est étonnament reposant comparé au reste.

J'ai cru comprendre que Tabletop Simulator faisait le même taff en étant plus complet, puis au moins si ça frustre on peut retourner la table, pas ici.

Évaluation publiée le 9 mars 2021
This is way more fun than I was expecting.
---

Yes it's as simple as it looks in the screenshots. You are just lining up elaborate domino lines with the goal of hitting specific trigger points like a puzzle. But you have a lot of freedom in how you set up the dominos and the physics have just a hint of chaotic bounce that you need to adjust for in your designs.

There's 40 specific puzzles with varying types of challenges like moving platforms and staircases to snake your dominos around or a free-play mode with a large open surface and up to 5000 dominos to create whatever artistic patterns you want. You unlock a few different colors/patterns for variety by completing the puzzles and can switch skins at any time, mixing which ones you put out just to be creative or to test your puzzle solution branches more accurately.
---

Bottom line: It's exactly what it looks like, a big box of digital dominos to knock over at a cheap price.
---

While you are here, would you consider following my curator page?

Non recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2018
Billiger virtueller Abklatsch des realen Spiels

Auf den ersten Blick wirkt Domino Sky wie ein netter, kleiner Zeitvertreib, der einem das befriedigende Gefühl vermitteln könne, präzise aufgestellten Dominosteinen beim Umfallen zuzusehen.
Dieser Eindruck wird allerdings durch drei große Schwächen getrübt:
  1. Die virtuellen Steine besitzen die physikalischen Eigenschaften von Sportmatten mit Marshmallowfüllung. Dadurch kippen sie mit einer unnatürlichen Trägheit, beinahe wie unter Wasser. Fällt ein Stein nicht direkt auf seinen Nachfolger, so kippt dieser nicht, sondern schwankt lediglich ein bisschen, sodass man die Steine praktisch direkt hintereinander platzieren muss. Gerade bei Kurven oder Steigungen wirkt sich dies besonders ärgerlich aus.

  2. Ein weiterer physikalischer Fehler: Die Steine fallen nicht immer gleich. Manchmal muss man einen Durchgang mit derselben Aufstellung nur oft genug wiederholen, bis die Steine ganz plötzlich wie gewünscht umfallen. So weiß man nie, ob eine bestimmte Aufstellung richtig ist oder doch lieber korrigiert werden sollte. So wird aus einem Logikspiel ein Glücksspiel.

  3. Die einzelnen Rätsel sind teils absurd (z. B. Level 24). Das beeinträchtigt unnötig den Spielspaß, v. a. dann, wenn man den vorherigen Punkt hinzunimmt. Das macht das Ausprobieren zur Geduldsprobe.
Fazit: Für Errungenschaftensammler gibts bessere, günstigere und weniger nervige Spiele; alle Dominobegeisterten greifen lieber zur realen Variante.

Jogabilidade _ 8/10
Gráfico _ 6/10
Áudio _ 7/10
On-line _ Não
Off-line _ Sim
Níveis _ 40
Conquistas _ 15
Cartas colecionáveis _ 6
Gênero: Quebra Cabeças
DLC _ 0

Obs.: Domino Sky, é um divertidíssimo jogo de puzzle com um conceito antigo e básico: Derrubar dominós em fileira.
A física do jogo é perfeita e a sua percepção de peso, de impulsão, funciona desde o começo.
Você precisa ativar certos checkpoints. E conforme o jogo progride, tais checkpoints estarão nos lugares mais absurdos.
O jogo usa diversas plataformas, níveis elevados, escadas, até espécies de balanças.
A quantidade de mecânicas existentes é surpreendente, e o jogo nunca fica repetitivo, cada nível é um desafio diferente.

Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2017
Fun little game that's enjoyable if you like setting up dominos and watching them topple over. That's exactly all this game is. I bought it with a %50 off coupon (so it was $2 USD) and I think it was well worth it. There are a few bugs, and the one level I beat just by mashing retry over and over which for some reason spawned tons of dominos.

It's a little game, with only 40 levels and freeplay, that's it. but it's also cheap. The music is pretty rad too, its all classical. Something about dominos flying through space in slow motion set to classical music is magical. I would buy a game like this one but with more content (like placable domino contraptions and stuff) in a heartbeat, but this is nice too.

Buy it when it's on sale or with a coupon if you like/liked to set up dominos and watch them fall over.

A game that takes a really simple concept and tries to build on it over a number of levels. The most fun part of this game is the fact that you get a quite good simulater of domino physics. The problem is, there isn't much depth the game can add to those physics, and so if they aren't constantly adding new mechanics to the game the levels feel repetitive are are a bit too easy. I enjoyed it for a good 20 minutes, but it's really hard to make knocking down long chains of dominoes interesting after you've done it 5 or 6 times, although if you do enjoy that process of planning out your domino trains there's certainly plenty of levels for you to enjoy.

Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2021
Есть пусто-пусто? Или один-один? Нет? Ну рыба тогда кричать буду

Привет-привет, играли в детстве в домино? Тоже наверное любили строить их в ряд и наблюдать как они падают одна за другой. Если да - то игра именно для вас. Погнали быстренько по фактам раскидаю что и как!

Давайте сразу к выжимке, там и особенности перечислю:
Выжимка
  • Графон - особо похвастать ему не чем. Куча доминошек и элементарные игровые поля (даже космос ничем не удивит скорее всего). В общем просто все с графоном.

  • 40 уровней - в космосе в невесомости и на поле с гравитацией. Порой встречаются уровни с сюрпризом. Думаю разберетесь.

  • Gameplay - надо выстроить костяшки таким образом чтобы собрать все шарики и разблокировать выход (звезда). Попутно придется напрягать мозги и решать локальные головоломки

  • Классическая музыка на фоне и ее не мало!!!

  • Можно заменить цвет костяшек на открываемые новые - по сути это не важно вообще.

  • 99р не такие и большие деньги не так ли? К тому же скидки до сих пор существуют!

Играть или нет - это дело ваше. Мне игра понравилась, она и расслабляет и порой заставляет хорошенько подумать.

7 / 10 костяшек домино (а ты чего ожидал?)
Всем спасибо за внимание, особая благодарность тем, кто дочитал до конца, а с вами был Tomov, стремитесь к знаниям и фактам, избегайте шлака в интернете. До новых обзоров!
(Остальные обзоры по фактам - https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198106191272/recommended/)

2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 avril 2017
Цитата из Википедии: "Принцип домино — распространение по цепочке (цепная реакция) определенного явления под действием какого-либо фактора, который влияет на первый элемент цепи."
Так вот, в этой игре предстоит расставлять домино таким образом, чтобы оно долго падало цепочкой, начатой от одной, а потом вообще уходящей в разветвления нескольких цепочек, потому что для прохождения уровня потребуется собрать на нём все "сферы" и уже потом "падать" на конец уровня(если упадёт на финиш раньше сбора всех сфер, то уровень не засчитается). Игра постепенно усложняется необходимостью использовать посторонние объекты вроде мячика или обрывами, ступеньками и т.п.
Из-за "нераскрытой" идеи и оригинального концепта в мире компьютерных игр - эта игра заслуживает как минимум плюса, просто промажки в реализации сыграли в какой-то степени злую участь для неё, отчего дальше по обзору у меня пойдут сплошные минусы. Поэтому смею предостеречь сразу: Если вы ПРОСТО хотите расслабленно посшибать доминошки, то ВОЗМОЖНО игра вам подойдёт, но у кого-то вроде меня вызовет дикое отторжение и непонимание уже до 10 уровня(из 40). В конце концов-то, суть в том что несмотря ни на какой обзор нельзя быть уверенным в том, что чего-то тебе обязательно понравится. Поэтому дальше читать исключительно заинтересованным в детальном разборе, а всю поверхностную информацию я уже подал выше.
- Недостатки графики заключаются в излишнем минимализме(для кого-то плюс) и сливании границ(их нет) возвышенностей с полом под определённым углом(впрочем, мелочи...).
- Недостатки музыки в том, что это классические композиции очень старых времён, когда и компьютеров не было(и снова для кого-то плюс, для меня же минус к оригинальности).
- Большое количество домино, которые можно проложить на каждом уровне едва ли упрощает задачу, скорее наоборот, запутывает голову излишним количеством вариаций прохождения уровней и создаёт иллюзию простоты игры. На самом же деле, её явно можно было сделать не сложнее, если даже не легче, пользуясь максимальными ограничениями домино, чтобы каждое играло свою роль. Но дело не только в этом излишестве "псевдо"-многогообразия возможностей прохождения каждого уровня, из-за большого количества доступных для расстановки домино.
- Дело в физике, которая нестабильна и может поменяться вначале, когда казалось бы, ты всего-лишь добавляешь домино в конце. Конечно "раз-на-раз не приходится", но "через раз случается" и эта особенность вызывает искреннее недоумение.
- Потом ещё и добавляется иная неприятная особенность, в связи с которой почему-то домино при перемещении может "не закрепиться" на своём новом месте и тем самым подпортить его удачную расстановку.

Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2017
Un jeu de domino comme vous pouvez en rêver, vous allez devoir jouer avec la physique, pour passer par tous les "checkpoint" et reussir les niveaux. Au premier abord le jeu à l'air nul et chiant, mais ce n'est pas le cas, les developpeurs ont ajouté des mechanics super sympa qui crée un gameplay ultra fun !

✔ Pas mal de contenu.
✔ Un musique sympa (quoique chiante au bout d'un moment).
✔ Une "personnalisation" des dominos.
✔ Des niveaux en difficulté croissante.

✘ Obliger de passer en qwerty (menu externe pour modifier les touches ne fonctionne pas).
✘ Prix assez excessif (pour moi).
✘ Des controles parfois difficile.

Conclusion :
Ce jeu est vraiment bien, mais il se situe dans la catégorie des "petits jeux" donc je considère le prix de 4€, un peu excessif malgré le contenu proposé. Pour ceux qui sont sûre d'y jouer pas mal de temps, fonçez ! Sinon attendez, une promo pour le jeu, car 2,50€ est un prix plus raisonnable même si le jeu est génial !

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2016
This game is a very unique game. The first couple levels are straight forward, but then it gets really challenging. Regardless, I was able to beat all 40 of the levels in less than four hours of gameplay. I love the customization mode where you can make your own domino creations.

I have two problems with this game so far. First, the physics tends to change extremely frequently. In other words, if your domino placement doesn't work one time, it could work the next time without any alterations. Second, testing out a Domino set could shift your dominos completely. These problems are especially apparent when you attempt to play the challenging levels.

Overall, as a domino enthusiast, this game is really great. However, the game's problems need to be fixed in a next update.

Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2016
Russpuppy, it’s good to have you back on Steamified. This is the second of the developer-publisher’s games that we’ve been fortunate enough to spotlight so far this year. The first was The Deletion which we featured very early on (January 7th). Where The Deletion was a fast paced minimalist puzzle-platformer Domino Sky is a much slower paced strategic game where the objective is to drop dominos into a lovely cascade in order to complete puzzles.

I love the game. I was one of those kids who used to pull out my dominos to put them on the kitchen table, the living room carpet or any surface that I could possibly find to see how many dominos I could get to cascade down. Some of my most cherished childhood memories were doing spending hours doing this with friends. It was one game that I was pretty darn good at. Winning came relatively easy but I truly did love seeing how artistic friends could be with their dominos. Therefore you could say that I’ve been waiting for such a game to come out for a long, long time. And with Russpuppy’s excellence of execution they didn’t disappoint me. Sure, it could be a little more polished but the game does what it sets out to do. I love the different challenges and that the achievements tied to them are spaced out that you have to work for the next one and the next one until you’ve completed the game which I am dead set going to do at some point. The physics are also pretty much close to perfection which is absolutely an important facet of the game.

If I had to nitpick on the game a little it would be that the camera is a little frustrating. I would have liked it to have been a little more mobile and easy to move than what it is. But it does move it’s just a little bit of a struggle at times to get it where you want it to be. Other than that I have no complaints at all with the game. There’s more than a sufficient amount of levels for a sub-$5 game and you also have free build mode for those who want to be artistic and build something spectacular.

If I could offer something a little unnecessary but a wishlist item for the title it would have been nice to see a little game of dominos implemented into the game. Perhaps unnecessary but it would have been a really sweet touch.

The game has been Steamified with trading cards and achievements.

A hearty and childlike recommendation. Thanks Russpuppy.

For more reviews and our popular giveaways please visit http://www.steamified.com.
 
Rick J

Mixed review: Domino Sky is a physics puzzle game where you arrange, well, dominoes to hit some specific marks on the map. The game has soothing classical music and casual play style. However, all the levels I have played so far only have 1 goal (to hit different markers), so it becomes quite dull after some levels. If Domino Sky could offer more in gameplay (game modes, background, or maybe even a story tied into the levels) then it would be a better game.

0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juin 2018
Aside from the lack of controller support, this game has another fundamental flaw: an utter lack of a tutorial. A domino master could likely breeze through this game with various techniques and setups, but the average player is not a domino master. The game should've provided examples of relevant domino techniques the player would need to learn at certain intervals instead of assuming that the player would know what to do. Setting up the dominoes was quickly becoming tedious, the toppling felt inconsistent at times, and when unmarked moving platforms are added, it became a whole new level of frustrating. I felt the game was expecting too much for too little.

In addition, the game does not factor in that some players would like to test in the middle of their setup in order to check that everything works. The reset option always puts the cursor back at the beginning and a simple preferences option could've addressed that. I can respect the fact that setting up offline dominoes can be a lot of tedious work that can be rewarding in its own way, but that does not translate well into a good PC game. Steps could've been taken to cut down on the tedium and increase the fun factor.

Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2018
So. Domino Sky is a game about placing dominos in just the right spot to succeed.
While the concept might sound simple, things get a little crazy towards the endgame. We're talking everything from rolling balls, blocks that move, wind and even antigravity!
I was very intrigued about the game, and found myself having a good bit of fun althrough some stages can become quite janky, and I found that sometimes dominos would disapear for no reason while resetting, and different things would happen each time I pressed start(?)
The difficulty curve in this game strikes a nice balance between showing you new tech, and using that to make "hard" levels, while I found some stages to be harder than others, the curve was not as apparent while moving through the game. (As in the levels didn't seem to always get harder, they usually stay on the easy side, which is good for newcomers)
Other than a couple of bugs, I still found the game to be pretty enjoyable, whilst actually keeping my attention for the whole duration. (The music was just the icing on the strawberry cake)

I would recommend this game to you if you're someone who likes to spend a little time relaxing and not having to think too much about what to do.

Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
Num modo geral é um jogo divertido, curto, porém interessante.
Ele é composto por fazes, onde o objetivo é coletar todas as esferas menores e aí coletar a grande "estrela".
O desafio se encontra em como dispor os dominós para atingir esse objetivo, o número de dominós é limitado e também temos elementos móveis no cenário que devem ser compreendidos e incorporados na solução.

O jogo tem alguns problemas de consistência, às vezes é possível ganhar apenas reiniciando a faze, nem todas as vezes o seu arranjo de dominós funciona de primeira, a física e o posicionamento dos elementos do cenário parecem oscilar um pouco, mas num modo geral, depende da sua estratégia para passar a faze.

Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2020
Описание:
Есть игровое поле, где есть старт, финиш и несколько звезд. Мы должны расставлять доминошки по этому полю, чтобы запустив цепную реакцию на старте они собрали все звезды и добрались до финиша. Идея неплохая и имеет право на жизнь, но вот реализация очень хромает... Дерганная камера, убогая графика, классическая музыка из бесплатных библиотек надоевшая еще в прошлом веке... Прошел несколько уровней через силу и понял, что не хочу этих мучений. Не рекомендую.

Оценка: 4/10

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2018
Completion State:
Completed all 40 levels (2.9 hours, 100% Steam achievements)

Comments:
This is a relatively simple but fun puzzle game from Russpuppy. Arrange dominoes to get shiny things. Levels vary from fairly simple to ones that require the placement of fifty dominoes, then repetition and a certain amount of hope that the physics go your way!

It took me about three hours to play through all 40 levels and I broadly speaking enjoyed them all. The relaxing classical tunes certainly help to create a generally mellow kind of vibe. The puzzles are fun enough, despite one or two requiring some repetition. Luckily the frustration is reduced here as you can restart the level with all your dominoes places as they were before and just adjust your layout rather than start afresh each run. The levels get reasonably complex towards the end but never to tough even for me and I'm pretty bad at puzzles!

4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2020
К моему глубокому сожалению Domino Sky совсем не про спортивный вариант игры, это пазл, использующий в своей основе принцип домино. На карте разбросаны белые сферы и шипованный круг ,ваша задача составить цепочку из костяшек таким образом, чтобы собрать все элементы при этом именно шипованная приблуда должна стать последней. В начале стройка века проста, но чуть позже она перемещается на движущиеся платформы, заставляя изучать тайминги. Ближе к финалу мы выходим в космическую невесомость и возводим целые копмлексы, заранее просчитывая куда упадёт фишка, делая цепочки веерными и полукруглыми. Прохождение 40 уровней зависит от прямоты ваших рук и как ни странно от банального везения и занимает оно примерно 3-4 часа.
Картинка явно не сильная сторона Domino Sky, графика как будто из игр 90-х, объекты банально некрасивые, нет ярких спецэффектов. В положительном ключе можно отметить лишь уровни в космосе и то они хороши лишь на фоне бедных собратьев. К музыкальной части претензий абсолютно быть не может, так как перед нами плейлист из классических композиций, есть что-то инфернальное, когда под Полёт Шмеля или Лебединое Озеро домино складываются друг на друга. Теперь о самом неприятном, в игре есть зачаточная физика, но она настолько отвратительно реализована, что местами процесс превращается в банальную лотерею, порой доходящую до настоящего абсурда, костяшки стоят одинаково и падают несколько раз с идентичным результатом, как вдруг что-то ломается и очередной запуск процесса начинает приводить к совершенно противоположному результату. Особенно критична данная проблема на уровнях с движущимися объектами, доходит до того, что просто расставляешь домино и несколько раз нажимаешь на старт, в итоге случайно проходя дальше.
Domino Sky довольно стандартный пазл, который портят плохая графика и отвратительная физика. Если вы не притязательны попробовать можно, но есть куда более яркие и интересные игры. 5.5 не более.

4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2023
Domino Sky, Russpuppy tarafından geliştirilen ve yayınlanan fizik tabanlı bir oyundur. Oyun 5 Nisan 2016 tarihinde piyasaya sürülmüştür. Bu oyunda, oyuncular bulmacaları çözmek ve seviyelerde ilerlemek için stratejik olarak domino parçalarını yerleştirmeli ve devirmelidir. Oyun, hareketli ve dönen platformlar, merdivenler, sıfır yerçekimli uzay seviyeleri, dev domino taşları, konveyör bantlar, zip hatları, bombalar ve daha fazlası dahil olmak üzere, oyunculara görevlerinde yardımcı olabilecek veya engelleyebilecek çeşitli unsurlar sunar.

Domino Sky'ın oynanışı, oyuncuları zorlu bulmacaların üstesinden gelmek için yaratıcılıklarını ve problem çözme becerilerini kullanmaya zorlar. Oyuncular domino taşlarını stratejik olarak yerleştirerek ve zincirleme reaksiyonlar yaratarak her seviyeyi tamamlamak için gerekli diziyi tetikleyebilirler. Oyuncular ilerledikçe, oyuna derinlik ve çeşitlilik katan yeni ve giderek daha karmaşık unsurlarla karşılaşacaklar.

Domino Sky'ın dikkate değer bir özelliği de Serbest İnşa Modudur. Bu modda, oyuncular yaratıcılıklarını ortaya çıkarma ve benzersiz domino kreasyonları tasarlama fırsatına sahiptir. Farklı kurulumları deneyebilir ve kreasyonlarını yakalamak ve başkalarıyla paylaşmak için kendi ekran kayıt yazılımlarını kullanabilirler. Ayrıca, oyuncular oyunda ilerledikçe, farklı renklerde domino taşlarına erişimin kilidini açarak daha da fazla özelleştirme seçeneği sunarlar.

Oyunun YouTube Let's Play/Reviewer'ları çevrimiçi para kazandıran videolarında Domino Sky oyununu kullanmaya teşvik ettiğini ve içerik oluşturucuların gelir elde ederken oyunla ilgili deneyimlerini paylaşmalarına olanak sağladığını belirtmek gerekir.

Genel olarak Domino Sky, oyuncuların zorlukları çözmek için domino taşlarını stratejik olarak yerleştirmeleri ve devirmeleri gereken fizik tabanlı bir bulmaca deneyimi sunuyor. Çeşitli oyun unsurları ve benzersiz domino kreasyonlarını özgürce oluşturma ve paylaşma becerisiyle oyun, her yaştan oyuncu için ilgi çekici ve yaratıcı bir deneyim sunuyor.

2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2019
At first it was a really entertaining puzzle game and I enjoyed figuring out how to come up with the solutions despite the controls being a little clunky.
Once I hit level 23 and it started becoming RNG based it took a great deal of the "solving a puzzle" and turned it into "Throw it at the wall and see what sticks", which, when combating the clunky controls just made getting through the levels a chore.
On top of that there's a few bugs in the game. Having to select your skin every time you progress a level or restart to change some pieces, and sometimes when restarting and keeping your pieces on the board some would disappear or changes you made last time wouldn't take.

After finishing all 40 levels I can say the best thing about this game is the classical music soundtrack, getting to listen to Halls of the Mountain King & Pachelbel's Canon in D helped keep me sane.

Although the quality ain't optimal and the kind of music doesn't fit me as a person, the music fits the game. The physics work okay, they are a bit wonkey (same setup can give different outcomes) but a lot better than in other simular games.
In my opinion, the game is just long enough but way too easy.

I'd say its an advisable game for 6-12 year olds and for those who like to play something simple on the toilet.

Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2016
Addictive and unique puzzler

In this game you are putting up dominoes and making your way to balls that you collect order to proceed in next level. For proceeding next level lastly you have to make your domino way to biggest ball!

This game have 40 levels and free play mode where you can make what ever domino path you want!

Also you can get different domino styles when you finish some levels. You can change those domino styles when accessing pause menu in game

Pros
- Great gameplay that just works!
- Relaxing music
- Smooth camera controls
- Plays on older computers too!
- Awesome visuals
- Level design is interesting

♥♥♥♥
- Dominoes style can suddenly change to default
- It would be great if I can make own levels and submit them to other players!


Conclusion

This is great and unique puzzler that will keep you busy for long times. You will definitely come back to play this

Игра класс! Расслабляет и в то же время напрягает мозги! Люблю подобные игры головоломки где надо реально думать. Классическая музыка успокаивает. Из минусов: При перезапуске цвет доминошек сбрасывается, то есть например, у меня были доминошки с собакой, а при перезапуске этого же уровня, ставлю я обычные и стоят у меня обычные! Также, если перезапускать уровень с сохранением доминошек, и ты сам убрал несколько доминошек, то это не сохраняется, то есть, я убрал лишние домино, перезапускаю уровень, а они на месте.
Если не считать этих двух небольших минусов, то игра действительно класс!

(урвал за 14 рублей по скидке, и вообще всем доволен)

1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2021
도미노 만들기

도미노를 만드는 게임입니다.
맵의 어딘가에는 가시가 쏙쏙 나와있는 특이한 오브젝트가 존재하며,
그 사이에 둥근 오브젝트들이 존재합니다.

맵에 도미노 타일들을 배치하여 가시오브젝트에 도달하는 것이 목표인대,
그 전에 둥근 오브젝트들을 모두 획득해야 가시 오브젝트가 활성화되어
획득가능하게 되죠.

이때, 도미노들이 쓰러지면서 오브젝트들을 획득할 수 있습니다.
그렇기에 그냥 도미노를 배치해서는 획득 처리가 되지 않고
적절한 거리와 배치, 회전 등을 통해서 도미노들이 쓰러지면서
오브젝트들을 획득할 수 있도록 해야하죠.

진행에 따라서 가장 기본적인 서로 떨어진 지형을 시작으로
움직인다거나 회전한다거나 계단형태, 벽과 벽 사이의 틈을 이용해야하는 등
독특한 지형에서의 플레이도 점점 늘어납니다.

아쉬운 점
-시야 이동이 살짝 애매함
-재시작할때 시점 초기화는 안되었으면 좋을듯(잘못된 곳 확인하고 즉시 편집 불가)

Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2021
I picked up this game on sale for half price. I've never been into dominoes in real life but a game for a couple of bucks was a draw. I've sunk 4 hours into this game and only have one more achievement to go. I'm not sure if the physics are completely accurate - someone with more knowledge would have to comment on it - but it was fun to fiddle around and try to make the dominoes hit all the targets before it hit the finish line. The levels range from incredibly easy to "I have no idea how to do what you are asking of me." Thank goodness someone has put up a video walkthrough to get me through those few levels I just couldn't figure out on my own. It's relaxing, easy to kill a few minutes, and my favorite - the achievements are attainable.

7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2019
Domino Sky is kind of a neat game.

Overall fun game as long as the puzzles can be completed with a little thought. Some of the later levels are annoying because they don't necessarily need problem solving skills, but require me to set up the dominoes and then rely on the RNG/Physics engine to go my way, such as the zero G levels or the ones with exploding balls that catapult dominoes around and hope to hit the other dominoes on the next platform to complete the level. TIP: Run it a couple of times to make sure the RNG won't work the way you want; If it doesn't, just change up the layout and run the simulation a few more times until you get it right.

Many of the levels have moving components that aren't obvious on what they are going to do, so the first setup is used to just figure out what parts move and where. Some of the fun was getting the puzzle right on the first try, but on these levels that wasn't possible and again required "Trial and Error" with the RNG

But even with the annoyances, Domino Sky is still pretty easy to complete. So above average game.

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2017
This is a really nice, simple game. It's a bit rough around the edges but the puzzles are pretty nice. The big problem is the fact that running the same solution multiple times can produce different outcomes. I can only imagine that this is because physics calculations are likely done by frame instead of at a fixed tickrate and since the framerate varies, the calculations are done at different times from the last run. This kind of RNG can make the levels feel unfair and frustrating.

Overall, it's alright. worth the +-$1 on sale

Domino Sky is a demanding puzzle game with a great variety of well performed classical music.
40 level and a free building map with 5000 domino pieces.
Level-based Achievements and a cardset of six cards.
A good game with tiny bugs, like disappearing domino pieces after you restart a level.
Just check your build and replace the missing stones.
10/10
